Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 48th overall pick, by Pittsburgh in 1971...
Injured on 7/6/1971 with a Broken Hip, out for full season...
Had first career hit on 4/13/1976, off Julius Bak (CBC)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/9/1976, off Andres Echeverria (NE)...
Won World Championship with Pittsburgh in 1978...
Had 5 hits with 8 RBI against Malibu on 4/2/1980...
Won World Championship with Pittsburgh in 1981...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/16/1982, hitting .500 with 2 HR, 9 RBI...
Traded from Pittsburgh to Wisconsin on 7/21/1982 (Going to WIS: C J. Bustillos, CF G. Albino, P R. Gallegos. Going to PIT: RF J. Cardella, 2B A. Gies, P A. Zamora, C S. Nolan)...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Catcher in 1982...
Had 5 hits with 0 RBI against Plum Grove on 5/15/1983...
Signed as a free agent by Plum Grove on 2/15/1985 to a 3-year deal worth $2,850,000 per year...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/26/1985, hitting .409 with 3 HR, 8 RBI...
Was selected to the 1985 Allstar game...
Injured on 9/9/1986 with a Broken Finger, out for 5 weeks...
Batting Leader Boards Appearances

1985 - 25 - 8th
